intro: Palala laevigata, commonly known as the smooth palala, is a flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually greenish-yellow and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in forest regeneration.
